channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: 'Arunachal in China': How an Indian-origin woman was harassed at Shanghai airport
How did Sindh become part of Pakistan? What is its link to India?
Why is FBI chief Kash Patel deploying Swat teams for his girlfriend’s protection?
Has India-born steel tycoon Lakshmi Mittal left the UK over tax scare?
Indian grandfather to be deported from Canada for harassing teen girls: What we know
Family lived off-grid with no running water, no toilet. Now Italy has taken the children away
US Sutra | Trump-Mamdani meet: Temporary truce or political theatre?
item.description: Politics is the art of deal-making. Not only Trump, but it appears his socialist critic and rival Mamdani too, is good at it

item.title: How PM Modi’s six proposals at G20 summit can redefine global cooperation
item.description: The proposals represent a conceptual reorientation of global cooperation, integrating cultural resources, demographic potential, scientific collaboration, environmental stewardship, and collective security

item.title: How US-Saudi strategic convergence opens opportunities for India
item.description: The US-Saudi re-alignment is not a closing of geopolitical space; it is a reshaping of it. India need not choose sides — only its own interests

item.title: View from Abroad | Revisiting ‘Macaulayism’ through Tilak’s vision: India’s right to choose its own education model
item.description: It is up to Indians to decide what kind of education they want for their children. The Macaulay model is still alive and well, but the national model is also a viable alternative

item.title: Rajasthan’s Jalore: A medieval fort town set for an inland port makeover
item.description: A 262-km waterway linking Jalore to the Gulf of Kutch will revive an old medieval trade route

item.title: Why Japan’s Sanae Takaichi must be firm yet cautious on China and Taiwan
item.description: Japan must lead with principled resolve in a precarious situation. Tokyo should stand tall, not in isolation, but as a pillar of a free and open Indo-Pacific
